quote: Stories You Can Feel!
author: Corey Aaron Burkes,  Scratch - with Audio Theater and Links

quote: I just knew there were stories I wanted to tell.
author: Octavia E. Butler

quote: Don't be satisfied with stories, how things have gone with others. Unfold your own myth.
author: Rumi,  The Essential Rumi

quote: Why write stories? To join the conversation.
author: Dorothy Allison,  Trash: Stories

quote: Someone has to write all those stories: why not me?
author: Elizabeth Gilbert

quote: Some of these things are true and some of them lies. But they are all good stories.
author: Hilary Mantel,  Wolf Hall

quote: The real problem with stories - if you keep them going long enough, they always end in death.
author: Neil Gaiman,  The Sandman, Vol. 1: Preludes and Nocturnes

quote: Stories change us; they change the world. People are stories of themselves.
author: Karen Healey,  Guardian of the Dead

quote: I realized that the good stories were affecting the organs of my body in various ways, and the really good ones were stimulating more than one organ. An effective story grabs your gut, tightens your throat, makes your heart race and your lungs pump, brings tears to your eyes or an explosion of laughter to your lips.
author: Christopher Vogler,  The Writer's Journey: Mythic Structure for Writers

quote: Stories are psycho-diagnostic ― they diagnose the condition of our psyches. When we watch, read or hear a story, whatever detail jumps out reflects an issue in our psyche that requires our attention.
author: Thea Euryphaessa,  Running Into Myself

quote: To survive, you must tell stories.
author: Umberto Eco,  The Island of the Day Before

quote: Stories are verbal acts of hospitality.
author: Eugene H. Peterson,  Christ Plays in Ten Thousand Places: A Conversation in Spiritual Theology

quote: Stories may well be lies, but they are good lies that say true things, and which can sometimes pay the rent.
author: Neil Gaiman

quote: Long before I became a feminist in any explicit way, I had turned from writing love stories about women in which women were losers, and adventure stories about men in which the men were winners, to writing adventure stories about a woman in which the woman won. It was one of the hardest things I ever did in my life.
author: Joanna Russ

quote: We owe it to each other to tell stories.
author: Neil Gaiman

quote: The best stories don't come from "good vs. bad"but "good vs. good.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: You know my name, not my story. You've heard what I've done, but not what I've been through.
author: Jonathan Anthony Burkett,  Neglected But Undefeated

quote: On the whole, stories don't write themselves.
author: Neil Gaiman,  Fragile Things: Short Fictions and Wonders

quote: Stories can conquer fear, you know. They can make the heart bigger.
author: Ben Okri

quote: Stories make us more alive, more human, more courageous, more loving.
author: Madeleine L'Engle

quote: My story was not the story of a girl's broken dreams: it was the story of a girl who couldn't be broken.
author: Heather Schuck,  The Working Mom Manifesto

quote: If a story is in you, it has to come out.
author: William Faulkner

quote: A story is a letter that the author writes to himself, to tell himself things that he would be unable to discover otherwise.
author: Carlos Ruiz Zafón,  The Shadow of the Wind

quote: We photograph things in order to drive them out of our minds. My stories are a way of shutting my eyes.
author: Franz Kafka

quote: But how could you live and have no story to tell?
author: Fyodor Dostoyevsky,  White Nights

quote: Stories you read when you're the right age never quite leave you. You may forget who wrote them or what the story was called. Sometimes you'll forget precisely what happened, but if a story touches you it will stay with you, haunting the places in your mind that you rarely ever visit.
author: Neil Gaiman,  M Is for Magic

quote: Stories of imagination tend to upset those without one.
author: Terry Pratchett

quote: We are surrounded by story.
author: Alice McDermott

quote: Good ideas stay with you until you eventually write the story.
author: Brian Keene

quote: A story was a form of telepathy. By means of inking symbols onto a page, she was able to send thoughts and feelings from her mind to her reader's. It was a magical process, so commonplace that no one stopped to wonder at it.
author: Ian McEwan,  Atonement

quote: If you don't like someone's story, write your own.
author: Chinua Achebe

quote: Tell the story that's been growing in your heart, the characters you can't keep out of your head, the tale story that speaks to you, that pops into your head during your daily commute, that wakes you up in the morning.
author: Jennifer Weiner

quote: Each affects the other, and the other affects the next, and the world is full of stories, but the stories are all one.
author: Mitch Albom,  The Five People You Meet in Heaven

quote: The story of my family. . .changes with the teller.
author: Jennifer Haigh,  Faith

quote: No guts, no story.
author: Chris Brady

quote: After nourishment, shelter and companionship, stories are the thing we need most in the world.
author: Philip Pullman

quote: The story is always better than your ability to write it.
author: Robin McKinley

quote: The truth of the story lies in the details.
author: Paul Auster,  The Brooklyn Follies

quote: Behind a life of influence you will find a masterful storyteller.
author: Mollie Marti

quote: A story to me means a plot where there is some surprise. Because that is how life is - full of surprises.
author: Isaac Bashevis Singer

quote: Long before I wrote stories, I listened for stories. Listening for them is something more acute than listening to them. I suppose it’s an early form of participation in what goes on. Listening children know stories are there. When their elders sit and begin, children are just waiting and hoping for one to come out, like a mouse from its hole.
author: Eudora Welty,  One Writer's Beginnings

quote: Women want love to be a novel, men a short story.
author: Daphne du Maurier

quote: There are only really a few stories to tell in the end, and betrayal and the failure of love is one of those good stories to tell.
author: Sean Lennon

quote: Maybe stories are just data with a soul.
author: Brené Brown

quote: Not only had my brother disappeared, but--and bear with me here--a part of my very being had gone with him. Stories about us could, from them on, be told from only one perspective. Memories could be told but not shared.
author: John Corey Whaley,  Where Things Come Back

quote: My circumstances of unrelieved responsibility and permanent distraction necessitated the short story form.
author: Raymond Carver

quote: Women want love to be a novel. Men, a short story.
author: Daphne du Maurier

quote: don't read the success storiesyou will get messagebut read the failure storiesyou will get the ideas become successful
author: Asif Jaana

quote: Write the kind of story you would like to read. People will give you all sorts of advice about writing, but if you are not writing something you like, no one else will like it either.
author: Meg Cabot

quote: Every story I create, creates me. I write to create myself.
author: Octavia E. Butler
